Azure Hybrid Benefit

The most cost-effective cloud for Windows Server or SQL Server migration.

  • Save up to 82% on Windows Server with Azure Hybrid Benefit and Reserved Instances.
  • Save up to 30%2 on migrations to Azure SQL Database 1 with Azure Hybrid Benefit.
  • Go at your own pace – move a few workloads or entire data centers.
  • Maximize your current investment in Software Assurance.

Accelerate your digital transformation

Now is the time to move to Azure and enjoy the advantages of cloud technology, which include: scaling up or down quickly, paying only for what you use, and saving on compute power. Whether you are deploying new virtual machines, moving some workloads or migrating your data centers as part of your hybrid cloud strategy, Azure Hybrid Benefit provides significant savings as you move to the cloud.

Windows Server SQL Server

Digital transformation enables customers to maximize the value of their Windows Server license

Similar to other popular Microsoft solutions such as SQL Server and SharePoint, customers can now use their existing Windows Server licenses in combination with Azure and take full advantage of this benefit to scale data centers to the cloud smoothly.

Lower virtual machine prices.

With the A-HUB (Azure Hybrid Use Benefit) plan, customers can deploy and run special price Windows Server virtual machines in Azure using local Windows Server licenses covered by Software Assurance (SA). Customers then only need to pay the basic virtual machine costs at the same rates as Linux virtual machine costs.

(refer to the Virtual Machine Pricing Details page).

Flexible, cloud-ready licensing modes are supported.

With the A-HUB benefit plan, customers can scale part of their organization's workload or their entire data center to the cloud, creating cloud-ready architecture that fits the needs of the organization.

Get this great value benefit now.

If a customer’s license does not include Software Assurance (SA), then now is the best time to consider subscribing. With a Software Assurance Agreement, customers can save up to 20% on Azure instance usage (this depends on factors including usage, instance type, and data center location).

To subscribe to Software Assurance, please contact your Microsoft Account team.

How to participate in the A-HUB benefit plan

  • Confirm eligibility and calculate licenses. For each Windows Server dual processor license with Software Assurance, customers can run two virtual machines with up to 8 cores or a 16-core virtual machine, whichever is lower in price.
  • Upload image file. You need to create a Windows Server virtual machine locally using Windows PowerShell, add the Azure Hybrid Use Benefit tag to it, then upload it to Azure.
  • Benefit from significant savings. Azure will subsequently bill at the non-Windows virtual machine rate.


Special tip:

2. Reminder that CPP and A-HUB (Azure Hybrid Use Benefit) cannot overlap or be shared: If your virtual machine already contains multiple deals, you will only be eligible for individual discounts which cannot overlap or be shared.

3. The CPP plan is a yearly service for virtual machines. It currently only applies to Online Service Premium Agreements.

SQL Database vCore-based options

For Azure only: Get more for virtualized workloads

SQL Server Enterprise Edition customers who have Software Assurance and use unlimited virtualization benefits can migrate to SQL Database at a cost-effective rate.

When the General Purpose option is selected, Azure Hybrid Benefit for SQL Server can offer Server Enterprise Edition customers with Software Assurance 4 cores in the cloud for every 1 on-premises core. The General Purpose option best meets the needs of virtualized workloads and can be implemented in a cost-effective way to migrate to SQL Database.

FAQ

Expand All
  • What is a vCore?

    A virtual core (vCore) represents the logical CPUs available to the server. Customers can choose between two generations of hardware. For servers created using the Gen4 vCore, the vCore is based on the Intel E5-2673 v3 (Haswell) 2.4 GHz processor. For servers created using the Gen5 vCore, the vCore is based on the Intel E5-2673 v4 (Broadwell) 2.3 GHz processor.

  • What are the advantages of vCore-based models in Azure SQL Database?

    With a vCore-based purchasing model, local workload requirements can be translated to the cloud in a flexible, controlled, and direct manner. This allows independent scaling of calculation and storage resources based on workload requirements.

    A vCore-based model is suitable for SQL Database Managed Instances, single databases, and elastic pool deployment options. These options all use Azure Hybrid Benefit for SQL Server. Therefore, pricing within a vCore-based model applies whether or not you use Hybrid Benefit:

    • Licenses included: Does not include Azure Hybrid Benefit for SQL Server. This option is suitable for customers who are reluctant to apply existing SQL Server licenses with Software Assurance to vCore-based database deployment options.
    • Baseline rate: Discount price that includes Azure Hybrid Benefit for SQL Server. Customers can choose this price by using an SQL Server license with Software Assurance.
  • What is Azure Hybrid Benefit for SQL Server? Am I eligible to use it?

    Azure Hybrid Benefit for SQL Server can help you to maximize the value of your current license investment and accelerate migration to the cloud. Azure Hybrid Benefit for SQL Server is an Azure-based hybrid benefit. An SQL Server license with Software Assurance can be used through it in order to pay less SQL Database charges (baseline rate). All vCore-based options can be used via Azure Hybrid Benefit for SQL Server: SQL Database Managed Instances, single databases, and elastic pools. You can apply this benefit even if SKUs are active, but please note that the baseline rate will be applied from when you make a selection in the portal. The credit limit will not be reissued.

    You can activate Azure Hybrid Benefit by proving that you have a valid license with Software Assurance in the Azure portal. The working principles for Azure Hybrid Benefit are as follows:

    • If you have the Standard Edition with Software Assurance, issued per core license, choose the General Purpose option and get 1 vCore for every 1 local license core.
    • If you have the Enterprise Edition with Software Assurance, issued per core license, select the Business-Critical option (coming soon) and get 1 vCore for every 1 local license core. Note: The Business-Critical option for Azure Hybrid Benefit for SQL Server is only offered to Enterprise Edition customers.
    • If you have the highly-virtualized Enterprise Edition with Software Assurance, issued per core license, choose the General Purpose option and get 4 vCores for every 1 local license core. This is a unique virtualization benefit that is limited to Azure.
  • What are virtualization benefits?

    Virtualization benefits apply to virtualized workloads on vCore-based Azure SQL Databases. They can be used to convert 1 SQL Enterprise Edition core through valid Software Assurance, to get up to 4 General Purpose vCores at the baseline rate. This is a cost-effective way to migrate virtualized applications to vCore-based SQL Databases. For example, if you have 4 core licenses for SQL Enterprise Edition, you can get up to 16 General Purpose vCores at the baseline rate.

  • Can I use an SQL Server license on-premises and in the cloud?

    The license must be used on-premises or in the cloud, but there is a grace period of 180 days during which the license can be used both on-premises and in the cloud to facilitate migration.

  • Can Azure Hybrid Benefit for SQL Server be applied retrospectively?

    No. Azure Hybrid Benefit cannot be applied retrospectively.

  • If Software Assurance expires, what will happen to Azure Hybrid Benefit for SQL Server?

    Valid Software Assurance is required to use Azure Hybrid Benefit for SQL Server. If your Software Assurance expires and you do not renew it, you will be redirected to the "license included" pricing corresponding to the SKU.

  • Which products are eligible to use Azure Hybrid Benefit for SQL Server?

    This hybrid benefit only applies to SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) and vCore-based Azure SQL Database options: managed instances, single databases, and elastic pools.
